amendment.description: Amendment sought to create a new 12 percent tax rate (phased in through 2003, for the first $20,000 of taxable income); increase the earned income tax credit; create a standard deduction for married couples equal to twice the standard available to single individuals; and provide marriage penalty relief in the earned income credit and the rate reductions.
amendment.purpose: An amendment made in order pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 104 to insert a complete new text.

action.text: Amendment (A002) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Rangel.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Rangel amendment (A002) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 196 - 231 (Roll no. 73).
